discourse_list.title: [Informal Poll] Should the PSM-USDP-A Parameters be changed as requested by Paxos?

content.content: Overview Paxos proposed a partnership with MakerDAO in which a variable marketing incentive (currently 1.95%) will be paid monthly in USDP to the Maker Protocol MakerDAO if the USDP PSM’s Max Debt Ceiling parameter is at or above a threshold of 1.5B USDP during that day. This threshold will increase to 2B USDP in 2024. The USDP PSM currently has $436M in USDP and a Maximum Debt Ceiling (MDC) of 450M which wouldn’t provide any marketing incentive to MakerDAO. This poll provides the opportunity to the MakerDAO community to comment on the proposed partnership and parameters on the USDP PSM, by adding friction to any outflow of USDP (by setting the tout parameter to 20bps) and could increase the protocol’s exposure to USDP by setting the MDC at 1,500M DAI. Paxos will be attending the community G&R call this upcoming week on Thursday, February 9th, and providing an overview of the proposed partnership and participate in Q&A. I would highly encourage the community to review the partnership post, linked above, and come prepared with questions for the Paxos team.  Proposed parameters changes for PSM-USDP-A: tin from 20bps to 0bps tout from 0bps to 20bps line from 450M to 1500M Those parameters could be altered if deemed too risky by a Risk Facilitator. Pros  Would generate up to 29.25M additional revenues Would diversify our fiat-backed stablecoin exposure (less USDC more USDP)  Cons  Will reduce intrablock liquidity reserves (20bps added friction) USDP is less liquid on-chain than USDC     Should MakerDAO change the PSM-USDP-A parameters as described above?  Yes No Abstain     0 voters
content.GPT-summary: The post explains a proposed partnership between Paxos and MakerDAO, in which a variable marketing incentive will be paid monthly in USDP to MakerDAO if the USDP PSM’s Max Debt Ceiling parameter is at or above a threshold of 1.5B USDP during that day. The post provides an opportunity for the MakerDAO community to comment on the proposed partnership and parameters on the USDP PSM. Paxos will attend the community G&R call to provide an overview of the proposed partnership and participate in Q&A. The post also lists the proposed parameter changes for PSM-USDP-A and their pros and cons.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Maker protocol is already holding almost half of total USDP supply and getting offered nothing. And we somehow trust they will honor such by setting a debt ceiling even beyond their total supply seems like we are actively trying to negotiate a bad deal.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: This poll is a bit premature since there has not yet been an opportunity to negotiate final terms. Delegates have not yet had a chance to publicly interact with Paxos, and are also still awaiting responses to suggested alterations. We recommend tabling this discussion until delegates can work out a framework to harmonize treatment of stable collaterals such as USDP and GUSD and USDC. We are generally supportive of some kind of partnership, but the terms need further refinement and input from a wider base of stakeholders than has occurred to date.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: Doo_StableLab:  Maker protocol is already holding almost half of total USDP supply and getting offered nothing. And we somehow trust they will honor such by setting a debt ceiling even beyond their total supply seems like we are actively trying to negotiate a bad deal.   The proposal requests an increase in the max debt ceiling, not total USDP help in the PSM. Therefore MakerDAO need not hold the MDC amount proposed and would immediately start earning rewards once the MDC parameter is changed, regardless of balance.     GFXlabs:  This poll is a bit premature since there has not yet been an opportunity to negotiate final terms. Delegates have not yet had a chance to publicly interact with Paxos, and are also still awaiting responses to suggested alterations. We recommend tabling this discussion until delegates can work out a framework to harmonize treatment of stable collaterals such as USDP and GUSD and USDC. We are generally supportive of some kind of partnership, but the terms need further refinement and input from a wider base of stakeholders than has occurred to date.   This is an off-chain poll to get community sentiment on the partnership. Paxos has been actively engaged on the forums and will be on this week’s G&R call to provide an overview of the partnership proposal and answer questions from the community.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Aes:  The proposal requests an increase in the max debt ceiling, not total USDP help in the PSM.   That’s my point. We are not getting any reward now to see their credibility so why give Paxos more concessions? Isn’t it better to figure out ways to pay out now and build trust and then move forward?
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: Aes:  would immediately start earning rewards once the MDC parameter is changed, regardless of balance.   “immediately” is a strong word. As much I understand you giving them a lot of trust, I afraid in reality, it will probably take some time. So yes, we should have the set up with current holding of USDP in the current setting first to have it paid out.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: I support the debt ceiling increase, but I do not understand why they are NOT offering tiered pricing starting at $0M. It is not market competitive to have a range of $0 to $1.5B earning 0%. This demonstrates a lack of strategic partnership view, not seen even in TradFi arrangements.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: Aes:  The proposal requests an increase in the max debt ceiling, not total USDP help in the PSM. Therefore MakerDAO need not hold the MDC amount proposed and would immediately start earning rewards once the MDC parameter is changed, regardless of balance.   Paxos can(and likely will) quickly mint up the max debt ceiling. Otherwise, there is no reason for them to request such a high ceiling. This is effectively a 1.5 billion dollar money market account with Paxos.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: I’ve edited the title to clarify that this is an informal poll. Forum polls are no longer a recognized part of the formal Governance process except for specific circumstances, but they can be useful in gauging sentiment. The only way to formally answer this question under the current MIPs would be to put it to MKR voters in an on-chain poll.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party asking questions about proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: USDP has no liquidity. Not even 1billion, this really makes sense to anyone?

Understandably, Paxos did not attend G&R today. Changed my vote to no. Would like to see a deeper analysis first from someone as to how any proposed parameters fit a specific set of MakerDAO objectives, how the new parameters will be risk-managed adeptly given the blunt instrument of Governance, and credible worst case scenarios mapped out along with response plans. Crypto Company Paxos Is Being Investigated by New York Regulator
